channel.title: jira.namics.com
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2194] 8.2 Events --> Refactoring needed (functional testing failing so far)
item.description:
Compare e.g.: test.distrelec.ch or http://test.distrelec.ch/de/LED-Stromversorger-60-W-Mean-Well-PLC-60-12/p/11025504

Given: 'activatedEvents' : ['add_products', 'add-cdo', 'acc-att', 'req-hbr', 'add-nsl', 'add-ltc', 'blk-afl', 'blk-acl', 'blk-asl', 'add-ltc', 'blk-rsl', 'cart', 'download', 'list', 'cart', 'compare', 'favorite', 'list', 'print', 'share', 'sup', 'fdb', 'nlt'],

--> So far no tracking-requests are transmitted (except for 'add_products') by click on the specified events (compare Spec p. 17)

  • OS: W7
  • UA: FF 25.0
item.summary: 8.2 Events --> Refactoring needed (functional testing failing so far)

comments.comment: Sieht mir eher nach FE issue aus.

Hi Dominic

  • Event 'cart' --> on product detail sites missing as second request (e.g. compare http://test.distrelec.ch/en/Windows-7-Home-Premium-ita-Vollversion-1-Microsoft-GFC-00142/p/11062288)
  • toolsitem.skin.shopping-bulk ('list'): So far not working
  • shoppinglist-add-to-cart ('add-ltc'): So far not working

Thx Mark
Info: only marks comment is still open. the issues described in the ticket are resolved.

1) Event Cart: This event is already implemented and only needs to be activated. But it is only implemented on the Toolsitem Cart Button (the icon one with the 8 corners) and not on normal Buttons. This means on the Product Detail View, a Click on "Zum Warenkorb hinzufügen..." does not trigger an 8.2 Event.

2) There was a bug which is now resolved.

3) Should already trigger an Event, see the attached Screenshot showing the two requests.
See comment, just call me if you think its easier to discuss over the phone.

4) Regarding 'Event Cart' (-> referring to 'toolsitem.skin.cart'):

--> In terms of Toolsitem Cart Button (the icon one with the 8 corners) the additional event is e.g. not triggered so far for 'Meta HD Flyout Search'

5) Generally please implement the additional event also for normal Buttons (Suche Global, Product Detail View, Meta HD Flyout Search, Compare View, BOM Manager, Shopping Lists)

6) Event 'Shopping Lists /shopping' (-> referring to 'shoppinglist-meta-actions'): So far not working

Thx Mark
4) Added 8.2 Event Tracking to Meta HD Suggest. Resolved.
6) Cannot reproduce. Was the event that maybe not activated? If the issue is still there, please describe it in more detail.

5)

Implemented:

√ Product Detail View (Buying Section)
√ Meta HD Flyout Search (Same as in 4)
√ Compare View
√ BOM Manager (Add to Cart und Add to List Buttons)

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

Not Implemented:

  • Suche Global

Please define Tracking ID and which Button exactly should be tracked.

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

Was already implemented:

  • Shopping Lists

Please define Tracking ID and which Button exactly should be tracked.

5) Okay (as discussed on phone: 'Suche Global' = 'Meta HD Flyout Search')

6) Event 'Shopping Lists /shopping': Event is activated and executed. However, the request is so far not poperly (aborted) transmitted. I have shortly looked into this: It seems that a pagereload is generated onclick. Question: Is 'sendunload' accordingly considered for the event?

Thx Mark
6) Okay. Which Event do you mean? "Add a new Shopping List" or "Add all Items to Cart" or another one?

6) The event 'Add a new Shopping List' is meant.

Mark

6) The problem here is the same as in another ticket: The event is fired, but not completely because of the following page load. The specification said, that sendOnUnload would make this possible, bis it does not work. As far as I know, we do not habe the possibility to track this event.

Hi Mark

Please see my latest comment. Unfortunately, I think this can not be tracked. But you could check back with your Webtrekk Contact and ask him, if he knows a solution to track something by Javascript with an immediate page load.

Please compare E-Mail dated Montag, 3. Februar 2014 09:09

Ciao Dominic

Danke für dein Feedback bezüglich DISTRELEC-2648 bzw. -2194.

Wie von dir erwähnt werde ich das gerne umgehend mit unserer Ansprechperson bei Webtrekk anschauen. Ich habe mir dazu den Quellcode (base-Js) angeschaut. Könntest du mir bitte kurz angeben, auf welche Js-Funktion sich z.B. die Klasse 'btn btn-primary' (bezieht sich auf den Fall 'req-snd') bezieht?

Ciao Mark

The best way to see this issue is in the form-feedback module. Suche dazu im File "http://www.distrelec.at/_ui/all/cache/base.js" einfach mal nach "Tc.Module.FormFeedback". Dort passiert nach einem Klick auf den Absenden Button folgendes:

1) sendForm() wird aufgerufen
2) sentFormSuccessful() wird aufgerufen
3) trackEventFormSent wird aufgerufen
3) webtrekkEvent wird gefeuert, was "onWebtrekkEvent" aufruft im Modul "Tc.Module.Webtrekk"
4) wt.sendinfo(webtrekkObj) wird aufgerufen

Diese Details musst du aus meiner Sicht aber gar nicht so genau verstehen. Wichtig wäre nur zu wissen, ob man einen Tracking Event auslösen kann, wenn danach ein PageLoad folgt. Aus meiner Sicht geht das eben nicht.

Move Implementation to on site link.

Rename onWebtrekkOnSiteLink to onWebtrekkEventWithPageLoad in webtrekk.js. Only used in newsletter subscribe so far.

Even if I put the following code directly into the HTML of the Newsletter Subscribe Button, the Request does not seem to be transmitted. You can try and add this via Firebug into the Markup on test.distrelec.at and see it for yourself.

onclick="wt.sendinfo(

{linkId:'ch.ons.test.-',sendOnUnload:1}

);"

Hi Dominic

As far as I know Webtrekk Js-functionalities need to be fully and properly initialised during page-loading. That is why a Markup-test within is not working in this regard via Firebug 'from scratch'.

A analogous working example (onclick-event Webtrekk function-call) you can find as following: https://www.distrelec.ch/home (click on promobox - compare attached screenshot).

For an according Hybris-testing please setup a 'onclick="wt.sendinfo(

{linkId:'ch.ons.test.-',sendOnUnload:1}

);"'-example on a test-environment (test-page) in order to test the Webtrekk-behaviour on the basis of a givne page-load.

Thx Mark

Hi Mark
Okay good to know, but I already tested this and I tested it now again putting the following link tag in the JSP:

<a href="https://distrelec-ch.local:9002/my-account" onclick="wt.sendinfo(

{linkId:'ch.ons.test.-',sendOnUnload:1}

);">Test</a>

I also tried the one from the current Distrelec Homepage Promo Teaser. There must be another issue. Is maybe a certain plugin not activated or included in the webtrekk v3 Javascript file?

Hi Dominic

I have created an according test-link on Q-environment (http://test.distrelec.ch/de//cms/Technische%20Informationen). Seems to work (compare attached screenshot)

Bests, Mark

Only visible in a traffic sniffer like fiddler.

Todo with Mark: Define affected Module and theri Link ID, see https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/Webtrekk+-+Frontend+Implementation "Events with Page Loads (ehemals Onsite Links)"

See Table "Events with Page Loads (ehemals Onsite Links)", I added every Module thats needs this.

+ Add ID, check that it is a "WithPageLoad" Event
+ Check via Fiddler Sniffer if Values are transmitted
All "Events Link Tags mit name Attribut on Page Load" Impelmented and Tested with Traffic Sniffer.

Hi Dominic

The fix-version v0.5. is noted. Howevere this must have been deployed later on. Is that checked-in respectively foreseen for deployment (FYI: not contained in the 1.1.6 Q-deployment according to release notes)?

Thx Mark

Hi Mark

This is already deployed on http://test.distrelec.at

Hi Dominic

Testing done on test.distrelec.at respectively last item on test.distrelec.ch:

  • sup: WT-request not transmitted in Chrome (thinkable reason: name-attribute before href-tag -> compare attached screenshot) / please submit 'sup-sup' in this case (as specified in the WT-Spec)
  • fdb: WT-request not transmitted in Chrome (thinkable reason: name-attribute before href-tag -> compare attached screenshot) / please submit 'fdb-fdb' in this case (as specified in the WT-Spec)
  • fdb-snd: Could not test that successfully. Please verify.
  • srh-snd: Could not test that successfully. Please verify.
  • spa-spa | spa-snd: Could not test successfully. Please verify (tested via http://test.distrelec.at/de/DET4TC2-%2B-KIT%2C-spieslose-Erdungspr%C3%BCfung-Megger---1000-404/p/serviceplus/90040788)
  • req-hbr | req-snd: Tested 'req-hbr' successfully. Could not test 'req-snd' successfully - please verify (http://test.distrelec.ch/de/Laborkabel-%C3%B8-4-mm-rot-100-cm-Multi-Contact-SML-100cm-red/p/14022002)

Mark

Hi Mark

I only tested the first one "sup" with my traffic sniffer and could see the request after clicking on the Button "Support". I attached a Screenshot.

Don't you see it in your Traffic Sniffer?

Regarding 'sup':

  • Seems to work with IE and FF
  • With Chrome the request seems not to be transmitted. On similar implementations (e.g. Footer-Links) it is yet working. Thereby the name-attribute is however after the href-tag. In order to get 'sup' also in Chrome to work I assume that the name-attribute needs to be placed after the href-tag.

Mark

It also already works in Chrome, but I changed the attribute order anyway.

I tested all those event IDs with my Traffic Sniffer and in my opinion they are all working.

Hi Dominic

E.g. 'fdb-snd' (to be transmitted on successful transmission of the feedback-form) I have also tested privately (no corporate traffic restrictions) on test.distrelec.at. The according request containing the ID seems not to be transmitted. Could you please attach a screenshot of the according Traffic-Sniffer request showing the request respectively the stated ID?

The support-'process' seems to be '2-step' by now. Is 'sup-snd' also implemented?

Thx Mark

1. Der Event heisst fdk-snd und nicht fdb-snd. Soll ich ihn umbenennen in fdb-snd? The event is sent locally on my machine but not on test.distrelec.ch. I am investigating the issue...

2. Support Process is implemented as one step. I will add the second step. Which ID should be used?

Hi Dominic

1. Sorry my mistake (mistyping) -> fdk-snd is correct

2. ID. sup-snd

Thx Mark

Hi Mark

1) Ok

2) Ok, I added this event.

I investigated why you could not see every event on test.distrelec.at. You have to add these events to the list of activated events via HMC. I added fdk-snd and sup-snd to test.distrelec.at and now you should be able to see those too. I attached you a Screenshot.

Ticket resolved.

Hi Dominic

I have tested the implementation on test.distrelec.at. Some findings:

  • Support 1st step: Current: sup -> Required: sup-sup
  • Support 2nd step (http://test.distrelec.at/de/Support/cms/support): Request containing 'sup-snd' is not transmitted on successful form-transmission.
  • Feedback 1st step: Current: fdb -> Required: fdb-fdb
  • Feedback 2nd step (http://test.distrelec.at/de/Feedback/cms/feedback): Request containing 'fdb-snd' is not transmitted on successful form-transmission. Request is however transmitted if captcha is entered wrongly. To be refactored.

-> Pleae verify for all according events on test.distrelec.at and refactor accordingly.

Thx Mark

Hi Mark

Which if the issues in this ticket are still open? All in your latest comment?

Thanks!

Hi Dominic

In my view there is preliminary 'issue' (pre-condition to enable thorough testing/verification) which needs to be initially tackled in this regard: In case that new events are defined and implemented (as the once in this ticket) their id's shall automatically be added to the list of activated events by default (given also in case of redeployments). Could that be implemented given a reasonable effort?

Thx Mark

Discussed with Mark on the phnone:

check sup / sup-sup and fdb / fdb-fdb and then close this ticket. for any other issues, mark will open a new ticket.

Changed ID's as described and verified that all four are transmitted:

sup-sup and sup-snd
fdb-fdb and fdb-snd

Can be tested on test.distrelec.ch after the next deployment.

Hi Dominic

As agreed I am going to test the above indicated four events as soons as they are deployed. For the remaining events I am going to open a new ticket and assign to you.

Bests, Mark

Please deploy asap on HP-Q.

Thx Mark
